Description: Four joined fragments from the body of Clazomenian black-figure painted pottery broad neck-amphora. Body, very short tongues in compartments: A, woman facing man, another figure, man facing left, man facing right. Purple for core of palmette; for hair of third, fourth, and fifth figures; on necking ring, which is broad and flat; as stripe on the dark inside of the lip. There are white dots in the fillets worn by the fourth and fifth figures, and white stars (usually of eight arms) on the woman's dress.
Curator's comments: BSA xlvii, 131-C II. 17. The palmette is of the type regular on amphorae of the Urla group
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 588, 10)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 151)
